verses.verse: “Because My people have forgotten (Jer. 2:13, 32) Me, They have burned incense to worthless idols. And they have caused themselves to stumble in their ways, From the (Jer. 6:16) ancient paths, To walk in pathways and not on a highway,
To make their land (Jer. 19:8) desolate and a perpetual (1 Kin. 9:8; Lam. 2:15; Mic. 6:16) hissing; Everyone who passes by it will be astonished And shake his head.
(Jer. 13:24) I will scatter them (Ps. 48:7) as with an east wind before the enemy; (Jer. 2:27) I will show them the back and not the face In the day of their calamity.”

Jeremiah Persecuted Then they said, (Jer. 11:19) “Come and let us devise plans against Jeremiah; (Lev. 10:11; Mal. 2:7; (John 7:48)) for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come and let us attack him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.”
Give heed to me, O LORD, And listen to the voice of those who contend with me!

(Ps. 109:4) Shall evil be repaid for good? For they have (Ps. 35:7; 57:6; Jer. 5:26) dug a pit for my life. Remember that I (Jer. 14:7—15:1) stood before You To speak good for them, To turn away Your wrath from them.

Therefore (Ps. 109:9-20; Jer. 11:22; 14:16) deliver up their children to the famine, And pour out their blood By the force of the sword; Let their wives become widows And (Jer. 15:7, 8; Ezek. 22:25) bereaved of their children. Let their men be put to death, Their young men be slain By the sword in battle.
Let a cry be heard from their houses, When You bring a troop suddenly upon them; For they have dug a pit to take me, And hidden snares for my feet.

Yet, LORD, You know all their counsel Which is against me, to slay me. (Neh. 4:5; Ps. 35:14; 109:14; Is. 2:9; Jer. 11:20) Provide no atonement for their iniquity, Nor blot out their sin from Your sight; But let them be overthrown before You. Deal thus with them In the time of Your (Jer. 7:20) anger.
The Sign of the Broken Flask Thus says the LORD: “Go and get a potter’s earthen flask, and take some of the elders of the people and some of the elders of the priests.
And go out to (Josh. 15:8; 2 Kin. 23:10; Jer. 7:31; 32:35) the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the Potsherd Gate; and proclaim there the words that I will tell you,

(Jer. 17:20) and say, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem. Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will bring such a catastrophe on this place, that whoever hears of it, his ears will (1 Sam. 3:11; 2 Kin. 21:12) tingle.

“Because they (Deut. 28:20; Is. 65:11; Jer. 2:13, 17, 19; 15:6; 17:13) have forsaken Me and made this an alien place, because they have burned incense in it to other gods whom neither they, their fathers, nor the kings of Judah have known, and have filled this place with (2 Kin. 21:12; Jer. 2:34; 7:6) the blood of the innocents

(Num. 22:41; Jer. 7:31; 32:35) (they have also built the high places of Baal, to burn their sons with fire for burnt offerings to Baal, (Lev. 18:21; 2 Kin. 17:17; Ps. 106:37, 38) which I did not command or speak, nor did it come into My mind),
therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “that this place shall no more be called Tophet or (Josh. 15:8; Jer. 7:32) the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
